meanings.definition: To surpass in plodding or slow movement.
meanings.sent1: Despite his fatigue, he managed to outplod his competitors in the race.
meanings.sent2: The tortoise may be slow, but it can outplod any other creature in a long race.
meanings.sent3: The snail challenged the turtle to a race to see who could outplod the other.
meanings.sent4: The determined ant continued to outplod towards the food source, leaving the others behind.
meanings.sent5: The marathon runner had to outplod through the last few miles of the race, pushing through the pain.
